Levi Harris

SN 226

232 S Columbia St

Chapel Hill, NC 27514

I am a first-year master’s student and researcher at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill working under the supervision of Dr. Tianlong Chen at UNITES. I am broadly interested in problems related to AI-4-Science – focusing on applying diffusion models and Transformers to material science problems. My current work explores novel imaging techniques for nanoscale materials (e.g., MoS2), including developing highly performant undersampling procedures for C-AFM.

During my undergrad at UNC, I worked with Dr. Gedas Bertasius to build pipelines for structured video generation and human behavioral modeling. I also built massive, (i.e., 30TB+) densely annotated datasets to push models to their limits.
